job description:
• *ROLE SUMMARY**
This is a laboratory-based position. The candidate should have a strong background in bioassay development using ICH guidelines for both antibody based and molecular biology assays and have a working knowledge of cellular biology techniques such as in vitro protein expression by Western blotting . The candidate will primarily develop, qualify and transfer assays in support of Vaccine materials release and stability for early phase vaccine programs using ELISA, Bioplex, qPCR, RT-PCR, NA extraction, or gel electrophoresis.
  • *ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES**
+ The individual should be familiar with the specific requirements and the associated guidelines for bioassays, as well as be familiar with the ICH guidelines for method qualification.

+ Contribute to the selection of the methodology and techniques to be used.

+ Independently design, plan, and execute assay development, qualification and transfer studies to support the release, stability and characterization of vaccine candidates

+ Independently analyze, interpret, provide conclusions and present experimental data internally

+ Perform routine sample analysis

+ Collaborate with colleagues within Vaccine Research and Development - Bioprocess, Analytical, and Formulation Development and appropriate partner lines

+ Author and review laboratory methods and reports

+ Keep abreast of scientific/ technological development by participating in scientific meetings/ seminars and through regular scientific review

+ Where applicable, perform job responsibilities in compliance with GLP and all other regulatory agency requirements

+ Perform timely notebook entries and review for completed experiments.

+ Perform other duties as assigned
  • *QUALIFICATIONS**
+ PhD in Molecular biology, Biochemistry, Immunology or related discipline with at least 2 years of industrial experience or an MS plus 7 years of industrial experience is required.

+ Experience in vaccine analytical assay development is essential.

+ Background in nucleic acid structure, function and characterization and/or antibody-antigen interactions is a major plus.

+ A strong background in biochemical, immunological and molecular biology techniques and qualification using ICH guidelines is essential. Experience with applying these methodologies to biomolecules, such as polysaccharides, proteins, DNA and RNA is preferred. Proficiency and ability to utilize techniques such as ELISA, Nephelometry, Luminex, qPCR, RT-PCR, NA sequencing, and gel electrophoresis to develop methods to analyze potential vaccine antigens and other vaccine components.

+ Proficiency with personal computers including word processing, spreadsheets, PowerPoint and relevant scientific software is desirable. Strong verbal and written communication skills are required.
